title: 106_s2307
content: The "Rural Broadband Enhancement Act" is the short title of the Act. The Federal Communications Commission will provide support from the Universal Service Fund. Section 254(e) of the Communications Act of 1934 is amended to provide Federal universal service support for the deployment of broadband service to eligible rural communities within 90 days of the enactment of the Rural Broadband Enhancement Act. The Federal universal service support provided under the Rural Broadband Enhancement Act must be determined within 240 days and can be used for deploying loop treatments, digital subscriber line access multiplexers, cable modems, wireless technology, and satellite technology in eligible rural communities. SEC. 156. BROADBAND TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES is added to the Rural Utilities Service Loan Program under the National Telecommunications and Information Administration Organization Act. The Rural Utilities Service provides loans to eligible telecommunications carriers for deploying broadband services in rural communities. Projects must deliver broadband service to underserved rural areas to qualify for funding. Loans made under this section must adhere to service and coverage standards, be in accordance with the Federal Credit Reform Act of 1990, have an interest rate not exceeding 2 percent per annum, and have a term of 30 years or the useful life of the assets. The Rural Utilities Service cannot consider the technology used when making loans. The Rural Utilities Service may take a security interest in assets or revenue streams for loans made under this section. Broadband service is defined as high-speed, switched, broadband telecommunications capable of delivering data to users. The Commission can adjust data transmission rates to reflect technological advances for eligible rural communities with a population of up to 20,000 inhabitants not in a Metropolitan Area. SEC. 4. FUNDING. $3,000,000,000 authorized for the Secretary of Agriculture for fiscal years 2001-2005 for the provisions of the National Telecommunications and Information Administration Organization Act.
